title: The Dead Beat
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: Now she was headed the other way. The bus was on London Road, then past the Playhouse and up Leith Street. Her stomach tightened as they turned onto North Bridge.

title: Espresso Tales
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: "You see a lot of neds . . . I mean young men hanging about, I mean congregating, down there. I think they go shopping in that ghastly shopping centre at the top of Leith Street. You know the one that Nicky Fairbairn was so scathing about."

title: Skagboys
author: Welsh, Irvine
snippet: Cutting down Lothian Road, she walked to the east end through Princes Street Gardens. Heading down Leith Street, then Leith Walk and reaching her Pilrig flat, she hung up her jacket.Then she looked at herself in the bathroom mirror.Thought about her mum, how she loved to meet her for a coffee, to show her a top or shoes she'd bought, to gossip about neighbours or relatives, or talk about what they'd watched on the telly. Soaping and rinsing her hands, she recalled that she'd put the towels in the wash basket.
